SEARCH

Class Labyrinth

java.lang.Object
Labyrinth
public class Labyrinth extends Object
Represents an instance of a labyrinth built upon a given int[][][] map.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private Direction
    direction
    The Direction the character is currently facing at.
    (package private) final Room[][]
    map
    All the Room instances of the map are kept in this 2-dimensional array instance field, in case the whole map is needed to be accessed in the future, for example a mini-map in the HUD.
    private final PrintStream
    printStream
    The PrintStream used for this Labyrinth instance.
    private Room
    room
    The Room the character is currently located in.
    private final Scanner
    scan
    The Scanner used for this Labyrinth instance.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Labyrinth(int[][][] map, InputStream inputStream, PrintStream printStream)
    Constructs a Labyrinth from the given map, with the given inputStream and printStream.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    private String
    commandPrompt()
    Gets input command from the user.
    private void
    commandsList()
    Prints the acceptable commands.
    void
    enter()
    Starts browsing this Labyrinth instance.
    private void
    forward()
    Moves the character to the Room at the current Direction if it is accessible through a door, else if there is a wall it prints a failure message.
    private void
    left()
    Updates the direction of the character after performing a left rotation.
    static void
    main(String[] args)
    A run of a sample labyrinth map.
    private void
    restart()
    Relocates the character to the entrance Room.
    private void
    right()
    Updates the direction of the character after performing a right rotation.

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • map

      final Room[][] map
      All the Room instances of the map are kept in this 2-dimensional array instance field, in case the whole map is needed to be accessed in the future, for example a mini-map in the HUD.

    • room

      private Room room
      The Room the character is currently located in.

    • direction

      private Direction direction
      The Direction the character is currently facing at.

    • scan

      private final Scanner scan
      The Scanner used for this Labyrinth instance.

    • printStream

      private final PrintStream printStream
      The PrintStream used for this Labyrinth instance.

  • Constructor Details

    • Labyrinth

      public Labyrinth(int[][][] map, InputStream inputStream, PrintStream printStream)
      Constructs a Labyrinth from the given map, with the given inputStream and printStream.
      Parameters:
      map - the map from which the Labyrinth is constructed.
      inputStream - the inputStream to be used by this Labyrinth.
      printStream - the printStream to be used by this Labyrinth.

  • Method Details

    • left

      private void left()
      Updates the direction of the character after performing a left rotation.

    • right

      private void right()
      Updates the direction of the character after performing a right rotation.

    • forward

      private void forward()
      Moves the character to the Room at the current Direction if it is accessible through a door, else if there is a wall it prints a failure message.

    • restart

      private void restart()
      Relocates the character to the entrance Room.

    • commandsList

      private void commandsList()
      Prints the acceptable commands.

    • commandPrompt

      private String commandPrompt()
      Gets input command from the user.

    • enter

      public void enter()
      Starts browsing this Labyrinth instance. Prints a success message when the character reaches the/an exit Room.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      A run of a sample labyrinth map.
